name: tito overview
description: This dashboard displays metrics from hosts where Telegraf is being used for system metric collection with Wavefront's output plugin.

chartSettings.plainMarkdownContent:
|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| ![apache http](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/wavefront-img/apache.png) | This dashboard provides real-time visibility into the **Apache HTTP Server** status. Apache is the most widely used web server software available for free. These statistics are collected via Telegraf from the Apache HTTP Server `mod_status`. Use the pull-down menu above to select the **Source**. Detailed description of each metric can be found in the  [Apache HTTP Server](https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_status.html) documentation.
| | |

sources.name: TotalWorkers
sources.query: ts("apache.IdleWorkers", app=${app} and environment=${environment}) + ts("apache.BusyWorkers", app=${app} and environment=${environment})

chartSettings.plainMarkdownContent:
|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| ![mysql](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/wavefront-img/mysql_90px.png) | Real-time **MySQL** status.  These statistics are collected via Telegraf from the database tables in MySQL server.  For more detailed description and control over statistics collected, visit [MySQL input plugin documentation](https://github.com/influxdata/telegraf/tree/master/plugins/inputs/mysql). |

charts.name: Instance(s) reporting
charts.description: Total number of MySQL server instances sending metrics to wavefront.

charts.name: Connection(s)
charts.description: Active connections to the Instance(s) selected.

chartSettings.plainMarkdownContent: This dashboard shows detailed system metrics for **${host}**. Use the dropdown menu at the top to select a different host. To add a new host, install an agent on the host using a [host integration](/integrations) for your operating system.

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: ts("disk.used.percent", app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and not fstype="squashfs")

sources.name: Total
sources.query: 100 - avg(ts("cpu.usage.idle", app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and not cpu=cpu-total), sources)

sources.name: CPU Usage
sources.query: ts("cpu.usage.*", app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and cpu=cpu-total)

charts.name: Load scaled by number of CPUs

sources.name: cpu_count
sources.query: count(ts("cpu.usage.idle", not cpu=cpu-total and app="${app}" and environment=${environment}))

sources.name: Idle
sources.query: ts("cpu.usage.idle" ,app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and not cpu=cpu-total)

sources.name: Nice
sources.query: ts("cpu.usage.nice", app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and not cpu=cpu-total)

sources.name: Soft IRQ
sources.query: ts("cpu.usage.softirq" ,app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and not cpu=cpu-total)

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: ts("cpu.usage.steal" ,app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and not cpu=cpu-total)

sources.name: System
sources.query: ts("cpu.usage.system" ,app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and not cpu=cpu-total)

sources.name: User
sources.query: ts("cpu.usage.user" ,app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and not cpu=cpu-total)

sources.name: Wait
sources.query: ts("cpu.usage.iowait" ,app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and not cpu=cpu-total)

sources.name: usage
sources.query: 100 - ts("cpu.usage.idle", app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and cpu=cpu-total)

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: ts("mem.*" and not "mem*percent" and not mem.total, app="${app}" and environment=${environment})

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: ts("mem*" and not "mem*percent", app="${app}" and environment=${environment})

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: ts("swap*" and not "swap*percent", app="${app}" and environment=${environment})

charts.name: Disk Free vs. Disk Used (Overall) Trend

sources.name: Std Dev
sources.query: ((rate(ts("net.bytes.sent", app="${app}" and environment=${environment})) as rt) - mavg(120m, $rt)) / sqrt(mvar(120, $rt))

sources.name: Std Dev
sources.query: ((rate(ts("net.bytes.recv", app="${app}" and environment=${environment})) as rt) - mavg(120m, $rt)) / sqrt(mvar(120, $rt))

sources.name: Processes Zombies
sources.query: ts("processes*", app="${app}" and environment=${environment} and not "processes.total*")

charts.name: System - Number of Users Logged In
